title: Album of Twelve Tanzaku Paintings
text: Zeshin demonstrated his design ability by choosing the attenuated format of the <I>tanzaku<I>, or narrow poem card, for this album. Each leaf represents one of the twelve months. Here, Zeshin depicts a dilapidated garden hut within which a miniature plum tree is blossoming, suggesting the coming of spring in the first lunar month. The second leaf shows men gathering to participate in cock fighting competitions, popular during the second lunar cycle.
description: ink and colors on silk mounted as a miniature folding screen in an album. Wood box and brocade covered inner box for this album.
creditline: The Putnam Dana McMillan Fund and Gift of funds from Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Wells and Louis W. Hill, Jr
